meanings.definition: (verb) (of a horse) to make a soft, low sound
meanings.sent1: The horse whickered softly as it greeted its owner.
meanings.sent2: The mare whickered happily when she saw her foal.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous foal whickered at the sleeping dog, trying to wake it up.
meanings.sent4: The wind whickered through the trees, mimicking the sound of the horse.
meanings.sent5: In the quiet barn, the horse's whickered call echoed gently.

meanings.definition: (adjective) (of a horse) making a soft, low sound
meanings.sent1: The whickered horse nuzzled against the stable door.
meanings.sent2: The foal had a whickered tone in its playful neighs.
meanings.sent3: The whickered mare seemed to hum a lullaby to her young foal.
meanings.sent4: The night was filled with the whickered sounds of the grazing horses.
meanings.sent5: The whickered melody of the horses soothed the weary travelers.
